sentences.english: He suggested that tangling fishing gear should be made a criminal offence.
sentences.chinese: 他提议，缠绕捕鱼器材应该算刑事犯罪。

sentences.english: Today one-third of the people on Greenland earn their living in the fishing industry.
sentences.chinese: 今天格陵兰岛上有三分之一的人在捕鱼业中谋生。

sentences.english: Its only inhabitants were a few hunting and fishing tribes.
sentences.chinese: 当地唯一的住户是几个以打猎和捕鱼为生的部落。

sentences.english: fishing and subsistence farming, by contrast, are reminders of a backward past.
sentences.chinese: 而农耕捕鱼则让人想起落后的过去。

sentences.english: Bycatch was not confined to drift-netting.
sentences.chinese: 副捕获物不仅限于漂网捕鱼。

sentences.english: My job is to catch people who hunt and fish during the wrong seasons.
sentences.chinese: 我的工作是抓捕那些在错误的时间狩猎和捕鱼的人。

sentences.english: Then it would seem that the disciples went back to their fishing for a short period.
sentences.chinese: 之后，门徒似乎有一段短时间回去作捕鱼的老本行。

sentences.english: Limiting the capacity of fisheries to match what the ocean can support.
sentences.chinese: 按照海洋的供应能力限制捕鱼业的产量。

sentences.english: My neighbor earned 180 yuan from one day of fishing." - He Yunying, 30 Gele village
sentences.chinese: 我的邻居通过一天的捕鱼挣到了180元。

sentences.english: Tourism and fishing are being developed on the archipelago.
sentences.chinese: 旅游业和捕鱼业在这个多岛国家大大发展。

sentences.english: Archibaid was a whale at fishing in his young days。
sentences.chinese: 阿奇比德年轻时捕鱼捕到了一条鲸鱼。

sentences.english: The county licensed them to fish these waters.
sentences.chinese: 该县许可他们在这些水域里捕鱼。

sentences.english: The agency said diversifying crops and the fishing industry is one key measure.
sentences.chinese: 该机构说，作物的多样化和捕鱼业是一项关键措施。

sentences.english: They first came to Atlantic Canada to fish and trade with Aboriginal peoples.
sentences.chinese: 他们最先来到“大西洋加拿大“捕鱼及与土箸通商。

sentences.english: For now, the Guidroz will put fishing on hold while the oil cleanup continues.
sentences.chinese: 目前，吉德罗斯将搁置捕鱼，而石油清理仍在继续。

sentences.english: But he also goes to sea actually in 85th days catches fish.
sentences.chinese: 而他却还在第八十五天出海捕鱼。

definition: to fish for (aquatic animals and plants)/to catch
to fish (with line and hook)/to dupe
fishing and hunting/fig. to loot/to plunder
variant of 漁網|渔网[yu2 wang3]
to make one's living from the sea
fishing boat/same as 漁船|渔船
